SHORTCUT.Definition: a quicker and easier way to do it

CASH.Definition: money (in the form of coins or notes)

SET FOOT IN.Definition: enter or go into the place

CAPITAL GAINS.Definition: money made from selling things like houses or shares at a higher price

SEIZE.Definition: take by force or without permission

ASSETS.Definition: things you own that have value (like money, land, or buildings)

FEES.Definition: amounts of money paid for the service

PENSIONS.Definition: money people get after they stop working, usually when they are old

SUITE.Definition: a set or group (of related things)

WANDERING DOWN.Definition: walking slowly, without a clear goal

HEALTHY.Definition: large or strong (in number or amount)

COMMISSION.Definition: money paid for helping to sell them

CAPPED AT.Definition: limited to a maximum number or amount of

WIDESPREAD.Definition: existing or happening among many people

ALLEGATIONS.Definition: claims that someone did something wrong (without proof yet)

CORRUPTION.Definition: dishonest or illegal actions by people in power

CRONYISM.Definition: giving jobs or help to friends, not the best people for the job

THEORETICAL.Definition: based on ideas, not always real

TENANTS.Definition: people who paid to live in the apartment

MONEY LAUNDERING.Definition: hiding where money came from, so it looked legal

INFRINGEMENT PROCEEDINGS.Definition: legal action for breaking rules or laws

PUSHED BACK.Definition: disagreed strongly and tried to stop them

SOVEREIGNTY.Definition: the power of a country to make its own decisions

STRICTER.Definition: more difficult or with more rules

DUE DILIGENCE.Definition: careful checks before making a decision

COSMETIC.Definition: only for looks, not real or deep

ESCALATED.Definition: made it more serious or more intense

PRICE TAG.Definition: a label showing the price of an item for sale
